info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 3:45PM CDT until July 21 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Nuckolls and Thayer.
* WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 344 PM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Sandy Creek, Thawes Creek, Walnut Creek, South Fork Big Sandy Creek, Dry Creek, Balls Branch Rose Creek, Dry Sandy Creek, Little Blue River, Crosby Creek, Republican River, Oak Creek, Spring Branch, Little Sandy Creek, Humphrey Branch Rose Creek, Rose Creek, Spring Creek and Lost Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Superior, Hebron, Deshler, Bruning, Chester, Alexandria, Hardy, Ruskin, Carleton, Byron, Hubbell, Belvidere and Gilead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING
